ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned and took away so much knowledge from this course. Knowledge about the content of different religions and philosophies around the world. Skills on how to dig into text, dive into deep discussions with others, and really ask the big questions in life in a tangible manner. This course not only taught me how to look out at world ideologies but also to look inside myself and see what reflections of other ideologies are within me.
I learned a ton about religion and various traditions, but mostly about myself and what I think is important!

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought this course, with its sections and guest lecturers, was incredible! I had the opportunity to see multiple section leaders (different instructors) during this semester, and if I had to point out a weakness it would be that, the instructors all have very different teaching styles, some of which I think are more geared towards this kind of course and some of which aren't. For example, one of the instructors came in for a day and guided the course in a really fast-paced, almost rushed manner, giving us questions to talk about but not really enough time to talk about them. Another instructor we had for a day treated the seminar as if it were a lecture and talked the entire time. In my opinion, this course works best when it is an open-discussion with minimal guidance from the instructor, so I thought that was something that could be improved.
This course was great, it was kinda a lot to watch an additional lecture every week but besides that it was great.
Wonderful readings and discussions in class!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Everything was well done and fair. It was a bit ambitious to still do a virtual retreat and I'm not sure how beneficial it was, but I appreciated all of the effort.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes absolutely! This course is so mind-opening and educational. I really appreciated every week of this course and the lessons it taught me.
I would absolutely recommend this course, especially to seniors. It is really great for introspection and learning about your values/ the values of others.
Absolutely! This is a great course to wrap up your time at Yale. It really makes you think about what values you want to authentically take with you.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: There were also recorded lectures once a week.
